title: given name "~syncthing~xxx.tmp" differs from name in filesystem "~syncthing~XXX.tmp"

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

milestone.title: v1.10.0
milestone.description: This release adds the config option `announceLANAddresses` to enable (the default) or disable announcing private (RFC1918)  LAN IP addresses to global discovery.

body:
How to reproduce:

1. Share a folder with a lot of files from A to B. I used a folder with 10,000 of 0-byte-sized text files.
2. While still syncing, delete the files on A, and wait for the deletions to sync on B. I actually had to restart the folder on B to get the two in sync.
3. Two folders are reported as "Up to Date" at this point.
4. Create the same 10,000 files in the folder on A, but this time with a different case.
5. Some of the newly created files fail to sync to B, because the previously created `~syncthing~<filename>.tmp~` files are still present in the folder.

```
[NISVV] 2020/09/09 08:25:08.279993 folder_sendrecv.go:684: DEBUG: sendreceive/uqzch-bwmvk@0xc0000fea80 parent not missing 368test.txt
[NISVV] 2020/09/09 08:25:08.279993 folder_sendrecv.go:1108: DEBUG: sendreceive/uqzch-bwmvk@0xc0000fea80 need file 368test.txt; copy 1, reused 0
[NISVV] 2020/09/09 08:25:08.279993 folder_sendrecv.go:1554: DEBUG: sendreceive/uqzch-bwmvk@0xc0000fea80 closing 368test.txt
[NISVV] 2020/09/09 08:25:08.279993 folder_sendrecv.go:1790: DEBUG: sendreceive/uqzch-bwmvk@0xc0000fea80 new error for 368test.txt: opening temp file: given name "~syncthing~368test.txt.tmp" differs from name in filesystem "~syncthing~368TEST.txt.tmp"
```

![2020-09-09-08-16-36-0361920](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5626656/92537154-68691000-f276-11ea-988b-d3b50c54f0f9.png)

The obvious workaround is to manually delete the temp files, but I think that Syncthing should apply the case sensitivity detection logic to the temp files too.
